header.titleText: How well do you know your election week No 1s?

questions.question: Sir Anthony Eden’s win in the 26 May 1955 election swept Britain into the post-Churchill era. Which crooner provided the soundtrack?

multiChoiceAnswers.answer: Dickie Valentine feat. The Stargazers - The Finger Of Suspicion

questions.question: 8 October 1959 marked a third win in a row for the Conservative party, led this time by Harold Macmillan. But which teen-pleasing single topped the charts this week?
15 October 1964 wasn’t just a triumph for the Labour party. Which famous singer was enjoying five weeks at the top of the charts?

multiChoiceAnswers.answer: Anyone Who Had A Heart - Cilla Black
(There's) Always Something There To Remind Me - Sandie Shaw

questions.question: This broken-hearted ballad spent two weeks at the top of the UK charts - one of which saw in Harold Wilson’s second election win on 31 March 1966. Can you name that hit?

multiChoiceAnswers.answer: Strangers In the Night - Frank Sinatra
You Don't Have to Say You Love Me - Dusty Springfield
The Sun Ain’t Gonna Shine Anymore - Walker Brothers

questions.question: It’s the summer of 1970. As Ted Heath's Conservatives regain power on 18 June, what No 1 was in a seven-week run in top spot?

multiChoiceAnswers.answer: Spirit In The Sky - Norman Greenbaum
Bridge Over Troubled Water - Simon and Garfunkel

questions.question: The first of two elections in 1974, on 28 February, led to a hung parliament. Which single stomped its way decisively to the top of the UK charts?
The second 1974 vote, on 10 October, saw Labour gain a majority to the sound of which huge hit?

multiChoiceAnswers.answer: You're The First The Last My Everything - Barry White

questions.question: It’s 3 May 1979, and as Margaret Thatcher begins her reign, which single is in the midst of a six-week run at No 1?
Thatcher’s grip on the country strengthened mightily on 9 June 1983. Which band swept the nation with this timeless ballad?
On 11 June 1987, Thatcher led the Tories to a third successive victory. But which other female(s) soared high this year?

multiChoiceAnswers.answer: I Wanna Dance With Somebody (Who Loves Me) - Whitney Houston

questions.question: It’s 9 April 1992, and John Major is surprisingly returned as prime minister of Britain. Which aptly named single spent eight weeks at No 1 then?

multiChoiceAnswers.answer: End of the Road - Boyz II Men
I Will Always Love You - Whitney Houston

questions.question: Tony Blair wins a new Labour landslide on 1 May 1997 election. Which R&B hit was winning hearts that spring?

multiChoiceAnswers.answer: Blood On The Dancefloor - Michael Jackson
I'll Be Missing You - Puff Daddy & Faith Evans feat 112
I Believe I Can Fly - R Kelly

questions.question: The chart mood shifts from earnest to upbeat on 7 June 2001. Which single was at No 1 during Blair’s “quiet landslide" in 2001?

multiChoiceAnswers.answer: Can't Get You Out of My Head - Kylie Minogue

questions.question: Blair’s final victory in the 5 May 2005 election came as the charts were awash with novelty hits and tacky sentiment. Which of the following stood at No 1?

multiChoiceAnswers.answer: (Is This The Way To) Amarillo? - Tony Christie Feat Peter Kay

questions.question: David Cameron revives the Tories at the 6 May 2010 election, and Simon Cowell has the UK charts in a chokehold. But which single caught the mood for change?

resultGroups.title: Rejoice! You've never had it so good. You know your election soundtracks as well as Nigel Farage knows his way around a pint of stout and a packet of scampi fries. Come back in five years and see how much you remember about 2015’s current No 1, Omi’s Cheerleader (Felix Jaehn Remix).
resultGroups.share: I got  _/15 in the Guardian's election chart toppers quiz and it was a landslide success

resultGroups.title: We can't go on like this. Almost great is not great enough. Do you think Noel Gallagher would have shaken the hand of an almost great Tony Blair? No he wouldn’t. Do you think D:Ream would have affiliated themselves with the almost great New Labour? Probably. Try again for ultimate brilliance.
resultGroups.share: I got  _/15 in the Guardian's election chart toppers quiz and did pretty well

resultGroups.title: Low to average – you are Mondeo Man, Worcester Woman... Margaret Thatcher didn’t win votes through being low-to-average at politics, did she? Nor did Mungo Jerry secure seven weeks at No 1 with smash hit In The Summertime by sounding average. Get on your bike and work harder.
resultGroups.share: I got  _/15 in the Guardian's election chart toppers quiz and scraped through

resultGroups.title: Oh dear. Your quiz labour isn't working. Scrub up on both your British politics and pop hits pronto. Go back to school. Or the library. Maybe take an evening class. Or just consult Wikipedia like a normal modern-day quiz cheat.
resultGroups.share: I got  _/15 in the Guardian's election chart toppers quiz and it was a landslide fail
